item.description:
Welcome! I am a sedimentary geochemist and paleoclimatologist. I research modern and ancient environmental change on land, primarily through the lens of stable isotopes in sediments. I currently work most with soils because they are the physical interface between climates and landscapes.

Exciting news: I will be starting as an assistant professor at Indiana University in January 2024! EAS is a fantastic community in a charming college town. Reach out if you are interested in opportunities to join the lab as a graduate student or a postdoc.
